maml:description.maml:para: Connects to a running instance of IPS Manager.

The Connect-IpsManager cmdlet connects to a running instance of PalantirIPS Manager. It checks if the current Windows user is a member of the configured IPS Admin Group. Except for the Test-Server cmdlet, all other PalantirIPS Manager automation cmdlets require that Connect-IpsManager first be called successfully.
Specifies the URL of the server to connect to. Aliases: Server, Url
Specifies the URL of the server to connect to. Aliases: Server, Url

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to the PalantirIPS Manager running in server1.planningspace.com.
IsSuccess : True Errors : Url : http://server1.planningspace.com ServerVersion : 16.1.0.0 UserName : PALANTIR\suser IsMemberOfAdminGroup : True IsServerLicensed : True
Connects to the named parameter ServerUrl.
Takes a string and uses it as the URL of the server to connect to.

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects from the current IPS Manager session.
The Disconnect-IpsManager cmdlet disconnects from the current PalantirIPS Manager session and removes all Powershell session variables associated with it.
Retrieves the configured distributed cache port of the specified application.
The Get-ApplicationCachePort cmdlet retrieves the configured distributed cache port of the specified application.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the configured authorized cluster group for the current PalantirIPS server.
The Get-AuthorizedClusterGroup cmdlet retrieves the configured authorized cluster group from the current PalantirIPS server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Users

The Get-EventLogLevel cmdlet retrieves the configured event logging level from the current PalantirIPS server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Info

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the configured value of the setting that tells the PalantirIPS server whether to generate or not a memory dump when unhandled exception happen in the server.

The Get-GenerateMemoryDump cmdlet retrieves the configured value for the setting that tells the PalantirIPS server whether to generate or not a memory dump when an unhandled exception occurs on the server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: True

maml:description.maml:para: Checks if the current PalantirIPS server is part of a cluster.
The Get-IsPartOfCluster cmdlet checks if the current PalantirIPS server is part of a cluster.

dev:remarks.maml:para: True

maml:description.maml:para: Checks if the current PalantirIPS server is the primary server of a cluster.
The Get-IsPrimaryServer cmdlet checks if the current PalantirIPS server is the primary server of a cluster.

dev:remarks.maml:para: False

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the configured Mail settings for the current PalantirIPS server.
The Get-MailSettings cmdlet retrieves the configured Mail settings for the current PalantirIPS server.

maml:alert.maml:para: If authenticated email is in use, the password will be redacted in the cmdlet output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: SupportEmailAddress : support@company.com Server : mail.company.com Port : 25 FromEmailAddress : ips@company.com IsSecure : True UserName : sender@company.com Password : ************

server.planningspace.com

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the list of PalantirIPS servers.

The Get-ServerList cmdlet retrieves the list of PalantirIPS servers. If the current PalantirIPS server is a standalone server, this will return a list of one. If the current PalantirIPS server is a member of a server cluster, this will return list of all servers belonging to the cluster.

dev:remarks.maml:para:
Address : server1.planningspace.com Status : Running IsPrimaryServer : True Version : 16.2.0.0 IsVersionValid : True

maml:description.maml:para: Configures the current PalantirIPS server to join a cluster as the primary server.
The Join-ClusterAsPrimaryServer cmdlet configures the current PalantirIPS server to join a cluster as the primary server.
Name of the database server instance that contains the common data source.
Name of the common data source.
Set to true to encrypt SQL server connection.
Set to true to always trust the SQL server certificate.
The server address of the local server.
Set to true to replace the previously configured primary server.
Name of the database server instance that contains the common data source.
Name of the common data source.
If using SQL authentication, name of the user that will connect to the common data source.
If using SQL authentication, password of the user that will connect to the common data source.
Set to true to encrypt SQL server connection.
Set to true to always trust the SQL server certificate.
The server address of the local server.
Set to true to replace the previously configured primary server.
The server address of the local server.
Name of the database server instance that contains the common data source.
Name of the common data source.
If using SQL authentication, name of the user that will connect to the common data source.
If using SQL authentication, password of the user that will connect to the common data source.
Set to true to always trust the SQL server certificate.
Set to true to encrypt SQL server connection.
Set to true to replace the previously configured primary server.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Join-ClusterAsPrimaryServer -DatabaseServer dbserver -Database commondb -username test -password test -LocalServerAddress server1.planningspace.com

Sets the certificate value settings of the current PalantirIPS server.
The Set-ServiceCertificate cmdlet sets the certificate value settings of the current PalantirIPS server.
Find value to be used in finding the certificate.
Store location to be used in finding the certificate. Accepted values are CurrentUser and LocalMachine.
Store name to be used in finding the certificate. Accepted values are AddressBook, AuthRoot, CertificateAuthority, Disallowed, My, Root, TrustedPeople, and TrustedPublisher.

Find type to be used in finding the certificate. Possible values are FindByThumbprint, FindBySubjectName, FindBySubjectDistinguishedName, FindByIssuerName, FindByIssuerDistinguishedName, FindBySerialNumber, FindByTimeValid, FindyByTimeNotYetValid, FindByTimeExpired, FindByTemplateName, FindByApplicationPolicy, FindByCertificatePolicy, FindByExtension, FindByKeyUsage, and FindBySubjectKeyIdentifier.
Find value to be used in finding the certificate.
Store location to be used in finding the certificate. Accepted values are CurrentUser and LocalMachine.
Store name to be used in finding the certificate. Accepted values are AddressBook, AuthRoot, CertificateAuthority, Disallowed, My, Root, TrustedPeople, and TrustedPublisher.

Find type to be used in finding the certificate. Possible values are FindByThumbprint, FindBySubjectName, FindBySubjectDistinguishedName, FindByIssuerName, FindByIssuerDistinguishedName, FindBySerialNumber, FindByTimeValid, FindyByTimeNotYetValid, FindByTimeExpired, FindByTemplateName, FindByApplicationPolicy, FindByCertificatePolicy, FindByExtension, FindByKeyUsage, and FindBySubjectKeyIdentifier.

Checks if all the web applications hosted in the current PalantirIPS server are accessible.

This Test-Server cmdlet performs tests to check if all the web applications hosted in the current PalantirIPS server are accessible. This cmdlet does not require Connect-IpsManager to be called first.
Specifies the URL of the server to connect to and check. Alias: Url
Specifies the URL of the server to connect to and check. Alias: Url

Application : PlanningSpaceDataflow Tenant : UAT ConfigFile : Dataflow Application Settings Name : MemoryDumpType Value : MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory,MiniDumpWithDataSegs,MiniDumpWithHandleData,MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo,MiniDumpWithThreadInfo,MiniDumpWithUnloadedMo dules DefaultValue : MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory,MiniDumpWithDataSegs,MiniDumpWithHandleData,MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo,MiniDumpWithThreadInfo,MiniDumpWithUnloadedMo dules IsUserScope : False IsUserScopeByDefault : False

Friendly name of the configuration file. Alias: FriendlyName
Name of the setting. Aliases: SettingName, Setting

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Reset-ApplicationClientSetting PlanningSpaceDataflow UAT "Dataflow Application Settings" MemoryDumpType

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the value for MemoryDumpType (found under "Dataflow Application Settings") from PlanningSpace Dataflow for the tenant named "UAT".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Reset-ApplicationClientSetting -Application PlanningSpaceDataflow -Tenant UAT -ConfigFile "Dataflow Application Settings" -Name MemoryDumpType

maml:description.maml:para: Resets the value of a specified setting for an application's server module.
The Reset-ApplicationServiceSetting cmdlet resets the value of a specified setting for an application's server module.
Name of the application. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName, App
Name of the category. Alias: SettingCategory
Name of the setting. Aliases: SettingName, Setting
Name of the server. This parameter will only be provided if the setting value to remove is a server-specific setting. Aliases: Address, ServerHost, HostName, ServerAddress, Host
Name of the tenant. This parameter will only be provided if the setting value to remove is a tenant-specific setting. Alias: TenantName
Name of the application. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName, App
Name of the category. Alias: SettingCategory
Name of the setting. Aliases: SettingName, Setting
Name of the server. This parameter will only be provided if the setting value to remove is a server-specific setting. Aliases: Address, ServerHost, HostName, ServerAddress, Host
Name of the tenant. This parameter will only be provided if the setting value to remove is a tenant-specific setting. Alias: TenantName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resets the value of "Disable Economics" (found under "Economics Integation") for PlanningSpace Dataflow.

maml:description.maml:para: Restarts the server-side module of an application.
The Restart-Application cmdlet restarts the server-side module of an application.

Name of the application to restart. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName, App

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restarts the server side module of PlanningSpace Dataflow.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the value of a tenant's client application setting.
The Set-ApplicationClientSetting cmdlet sets the value of a tenant's client application setting.
Name of the application. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName, App
Name of the tenant. Alias: TenantName
Friendly name of the configuration file. Alias: FriendlyName
Name of the setting. Aliases: SettingName, Setting
Value to set.
Set to True (1) if the setting is user-scoped. Set to False (0) if the setting is tenant-scoped.
Name of the application. Aliases: ApplicationName, AppName, App
Name of the tenant. Alias: TenantName
Friendly name of the configuration file. Alias: FriendlyName
Name of the setting. Aliases: SettingName, Setting
Value to set.
Set to True (1) if the setting is user-scoped. Set to False (0) if the setting is tenant-scoped.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-ApplicationClientSetting PlanningSpaceDataflow UAT "Dataflow Application Settings" MemoryDumpType "MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory,MiniDumpWithDataSegs" 0

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the value of the MemoryDumpType setting (found under "Dataflow Application Settings") to "MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory,MiniDumpWithDataSegs" for the tenant named "UAT".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-ApplicationClientSetting -Application PlanningSpaceDataflow -Tenant UAT -ConfigFile "Dataflow Application Settings" -Name MemoryDumpType -Value "MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory,MiniDumpWithDataSegs" -IsUserScope 0

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-ApplicationServiceSetting PlanningSpaceDataflow "Economics Integration" "Disable Economics" -Value False -Tenant UAT

maml:description.maml:para: Removes all user sessions.
The Clear-UserSession cmdlet removes all user sessions for a specified tenant. If the license server is in CentralizedPool mode, all user sessions will be removed.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode.

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the license server is in CentralizedPool mode, clears all user sessions.
No output if success.
If the license server is in PerTenant mode, clears all user sessions from the tenant named "Default".
No output if success.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all the current server licenses on the IPS server.
The Get-IpsServerLicense cmdlet retrieves a list of all the current server licenses on the IPS server. Revoked licenses will be excluded.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of licenses on the IPS server.

Id : 90265b16-d690-43fc-b5a9-9992fb837968/0 Name : PlanningSpace™ IPS (Initial Server) StartDate : 16/03/2016 00:00:00 EndDate : 31/12/2017 00:00:00 UseType : Test Environment LicenseCount : 1 ModuleIds : {PalantirIPS Server} Comments : MaxPingInterval : 0 Revision : WarnIfExpiryClose : 14 ExpiryStatus : Active

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the base url of the license server.
The Get-LicenseServerUrl cmdlet retrieves the base url of the license server. If the license server is in PerTenant mode, the tenant parameter must be specified.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode.

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the license server is in CentralizedPool mode, gets the license server base URL.
http://ipsserver/licenseserver
Gets the license server base URL for the tenant named "Default".
http://ipsserver/licenseserver/default

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the current licensing mode of the IPS server.
The Get-LicensingMode cmdlet retrieves the current licensing mode of the IPS server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: CentralizedPool

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a list of all the current product licenses on the license server.
The Get-ProductLicense cmdlet retrieves a list of all the current product licenses on the license server. Revoked licenses will be excluded.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode. Alias: TenantName.
The name of the tenant. This parameter only applies if the license server is in PerTenant mode. Alias: TenantName.

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the license server is in CentralizedPool mode, gets all product licenses.

Id : e325db61-34b6-4b29-9bf3-58a0cc821555/1 Name : PalantirPLAN StartDate : 25/07/2016 00:00:00 EndDate : 24/08/2017 00:00:00 IsConcurrentLicense : False IsNamedUserLicense : True UseType : Test Environment LicenseCount : 3 NamedUsers : {user1@company1.com, user2@company1.com} ModuleIds : {PalantirPLAN} Comments : MaxPingInterval : 2 Revision : WarnIfExpiryClose : 14 ExpiryStatus : Active
Id : e325db61-34b6-4b29-9bf3-58a0cc821555/2 Name : PalantirFINANCIALS StartDate : 25/07/2016 00:00:00 EndDate : 24/08/2017 00:00:00 IsConcurrentLicense : False IsNamedUserLicense : False UseType : Test Environment LicenseCount : 3 NamedUsers : ModuleIds : {PalantirFINANCIALS} Comments : MaxPingInterval : 2 Revision : WarnIfExpiryClose : 14 ExpiryStatus : Active
If the license server is in PerTenant mode, gets all product licenses from the tenant named "Default".

maml:description.maml:para: Revokes a product license.
The Remove-ProductLicense cmdlet removes a current product license from the server. Revoking a license cannot be undone; removed licenses cannot be reuploaded.

The product license ID of the license to be revoked. Alias: License.

If the license server is in CentralizedPool mode, turns off Proxy Server mode.

The Set-TenantClusterTempFolder cmdlet sets the tenant cluster temp folder location for a specified tenant. To use this cmdlet, the tenant data source must first be set. Both your IPS and SQL server will also require access rights to the location you specify.
The name of the tenant.
The cluster temp folder location to set.
The name of the tenant.
The cluster temp folder location to set.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the Cluster Shared Temp Folder location to T:\sharedfolder for the tenant named "Default".

Allocates or de-allocates a processor to or from a processing category on a specified server.
The Set-ProcessorAffinity cmdlet allocates or de-allocates a processor to or from a processing category on a specified server. Any processor not in the ProcessorList will be deallocated.

The list of processors, delimited by commas. Processor number starts at 0 and Total processor - 1. Any number outside of this range will be ignored.

The list of processors, delimited by commas. Processor number starts at 0 and Total processor - 1. Any number outside of this range will be ignored.

The Get-ProcessorAffinity cmdlet retrieves a list of processors that are binded to the IPS worker process (eg. a returned list of 1,3,4 means that CPU1, CPU3, and CPU4 are binded).

The name of the server.

Retrieves a list of processors for a specifcied server.

The Get-ProcessorList cmdlet retrieves a list of processors that can be used by IPS Workers. To set processor affinity for IPS Workers, please see the Get-ProcessorAffinity and Set-ProcessorAffinity cmdlets.
Name of the server. Alias: Address, ServerAddress, ServerHost, Host and HostName.
Name of the server. Alias: Address, ServerAddress, ServerHost, Host and HostName.

CPU0 CPU1 CPU2 CPU3

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the SAML2 identity provider of the specified tenant.
The Get-TenantSML2IdentityProvider cmdlet gets the SAML2 identity provider of the specified tenant.
The name of the tenant.
The name of the tenant.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the SAML2 identity provider of the tenant named "default". The IdP has a certificate assigned therefore the HasCertificate value shows as "True"

TenantName : default ProviderName : identity1 ProviderType : SAML2 ProviderUrl : http://localhost4 ACSBinding : POST SSOUrl : http://localhost5 SSOBinding : Redirect SLOUrl : http://localhost6 SLOBinding : Redirect UserNameClaim : http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier ClockSkew : 3 RejectUnsignedAssertion : True HasCertificate : True
Gets the SAML2 identity provider of the tenant named "default2". The IdP does not have a certificate assigned therefore the HasCertificate value shows as "False"

TenantName : default2 ProviderName : identity1 ProviderType : SAML2 ProviderUrl : http://localhost4 ACSBinding : POST SSOUrl : http://localhost5 SSOBinding : Redirect SLOUrl : http://localhost6 SLOBinding : Redirect UserNameClaim : http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier ClockSkew : 3 RejectUnsignedAssertion : True HasCertificate : False

The name of the tenant.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the SAML2 identity provider of the specified tenant.
The Set-TenantSML2IdentityProvider cmdlet sets the SAML2 identity provider of the specified tenant.
The name of the tenant.
Any string name/id that the administrator wants to logically associate with this identity provider
Identity provider’s URL
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when the identity provider sends SAML responses to IPS authententication service Possible values: POST, Artifact.
The endpoint of the identity provider where SAML authentication requests are to be sent
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when sending SAML authentication requests to the identity provider Possible values: Redirect, POST, Artifact
The endpoint of the identity provider where SAML logout messages are to be sent.
True if IPS is to reject any unsigned assertion from the external SAML2 identity provider.
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when sending SAML logout messages to the identity provider Possible values: Redirect, POST, Artifact
Claim to be used to determine the name of the user authenticated by the external SAML2 identity provider.
Allowance, in minutes, for the clock difference between the IPS server machine and the machine hosting the external SAML2 identity provider.
The path of the X.509 certificate being used by the external identity provider for signing This is assumed to be to a base-64 encoded X.509 certificate (.CER)
The name of the tenant.
Any string name/id that the administrator wants to logically associate with this identity provider
Identity provider’s URL
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when the identity provider sends SAML responses to IPS authententication service Possible values: POST, Artifact.
The endpoint of the identity provider where SAML authentication requests are to be sent
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when sending SAML authentication requests to the identity provider Possible values: Redirect, POST, Artifact
The endpoint of the identity provider where SAML logout messages are to be sent.
True if IPS is to reject any unsigned assertion from the external SAML2 identity provider.
Specifies the transport mechanism to use when sending SAML logout messages to the identity provider Possible values: Redirect, POST, Artifact
Claim to be used to determine the name of the user authenticated by the external SAML2 identity provider.
Allowance, in minutes, for the clock difference between the IPS server machine and the machine hosting the external SAML2 identity provider.
The path of the X.509 certificate being used by the external identity provider for signing This is assumed to be to a base-64 encoded X.509 certificate (.CER)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-TenantSAML2IdentityProvider -Tenant Tenant1 -ProviderName identity1 -ProviderUrl http://localhost4 -ACSBinding POST -SSOUrl http://localhost5 -SSOBinding Artifact -SLOUrl http://localhost6 -SLOBinding Artifact -RejectUnsignedAssertion True -ClockSkew 30 -UserNameClaim http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the updates or adds the SAML2 identity provider of the tenant named "Tenant1". The IdP will be named "identity1" and will have ProviderUrl = http://localhost4, SSOUrl = http://localhost5, SLOUrl = http://localhost6, ACSBinding = POST, SSOBinding = Artifact and SLOBinding = Artifact, unsigned assertion will be rejected, clock skew is set to 30 and nameid claim will be used as user name. The certificate will NOT be set.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-TenantSAML2IdentityProvider -Tenant default -ProviderName identity1 -ProviderUrl http://localhost4 -SSOUrl http://localhost5 -SLOUrl http://localhost6 -CertificateFilePath C:\temp\Certs\test.cer -RejectUnsignedAssertion True -ClockSkew 30 -UserNameClaim http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the updates or adds the SAML2 identity provider of the tenant named "default". The IdP will be named "identity1" and will have ProviderUrl = http://localhost4, SSOUrl = http://localhost5, SLOUrl = http://localhost6 and certificate loaded from C:\temp\Certs\test.cer, unsigned assertion will be rejected, clock skew is set to 30 and nameid claim will be used as user name. The binding arguments will be set to the defaults.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the token lifetime of the specified tenant.
The Set-TenantSML2IdentityProvider cmdlet sets the token lifetime of the specified tenant.
The name of the tenant.
Toke lifetime, in minutes
The name of the tenant.
Toke lifetime, in minutes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the token lifetime of the tenant named "default" to 30 minutes.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a list of processors that are bound to the application process.

The Get-ApplicationProcessorAffinity cmdlet retrieves a list of processors that are bound to the application process (eg. a returned list of 1,3,4 means that CPU1, CPU3, and CPU4 are bound to the application process).
The name of the server.
The name of the application.
The name of the server.
The name of the application.
Allocates or de-allocates a processor to or from an application process on a specified server.
The Set-ApplicationProcessorAffinity cmdlet allocates or de-allocates a processor to or from an application process on a specified server. Any processor not in the ProcessorList will be deallocated.
The name of the server.
The name of the application.
The list of processors, delimited by commas. Processor number starts at 0 and Total processor - 1. Any number outside of this range will be ignored.
The name of the server.
The name of the application.
The list of processors, delimited by commas. Processor number starts at 0 and Total processor - 1. Any number outside of this range will be ignored.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Binds processors 1, 4, and 5 to PlanningSpaceEconomics application.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts plain text strings to encrypted strings with Aucerna encryption logic.

The ConvertTo-EncryptedText cmdlet converts plain text strings into encrypted strings with Aucerna encryption logic. The encrypted string created by the cmdlet can be used with cmdlets or functions that require an encrypted string e.g. password.
Specifies the text to encrypt
Specifies the text to encrypt

dev:remarks.maml:para: Encrypts the plain text and displays the output
